text: Gilbert Fitzgerald Coan (May 18, 1922 â€“ February 4, 2020) was an American professional baseball outfielder. He was born in Monroe, North Carolina. Coan played in Major League Baseball (MLB) for the Washington Senators, Baltimore Orioles, Chicago White Sox and the New York Giants."Gil Coan Statistics and History". baseball-reference.com. Retrieved on 2017-05-07. He batted left- handed and threw right-handed. Before his death in 2020, he was the oldest living former New York Giants player. Coan died on February 4, 2020 in Hendersonville, North Carolina. He was 97. ==References== ==Other websites== *Baseball Library *Brevard Insurance Agency *Retrosheet Category:1922 births Category:2020 deaths Category:San Francisco Giants players Category:Minnesota Twins players Category:Baltimore Orioles players Category:Chicago White Sox players Category:Sportspeople from North Carolina
title: Gil Coan
